numeric_1.name: Numeric Algebra 1
numeric_1.objective: Solve algebraic equations with one or two steps to find a numeric answer.

slope_1.name: Finding Slope 1
slope_1.objective: Find slope of a line on graphs with integer scales.

numeric_2.name: Numeric Algebra 2
numeric_2.objective: Solve algebraic equations with three or four steps to find a numeric answer.

symbolic_algebra_1.name: Symbolic Algebra 1
symbolic_algebra_1.objective: Solve algebraic equations with one or two steps to find a symbolic answer.

slope_2.name: Finding Slope 2
slope_2.objective: Find slope of a line on graphs with decimal scales.

area_under_a_curve_1.name: Area Under a Curve 1
area_under_a_curve_1.objective: Find area under a curve that includes only rectangles.

symbolic_algebra_2.name: Symbolic Algebra 2
symbolic_algebra_2.objective: Solve algebraic equations with three or four steps to find a symbolic answer.

system_of_equations_numeric.name: Numeric System of Equations
system_of_equations_numeric.objective: Solve a system of equations numerically.

area_under_a_curve_2.name: Area Under a Curve 2
area_under_a_curve_2.objective: Find the area under a curve that includes rectangles, triangles, and trapezoids.

representing_lines.name: Representing Lines with an Equation
representing_lines.objective: Represent lines with an algebraic equation.

system_of_equations_symbolic.name: Symbolic System of Equations
system_of_equations_symbolic.objective: Solve a system of equations symbolically.

representing_parabolas.name: Representing Parabolas with an Equation
representing_parabolas.objective: Represent parabolas with an algebraic equation.

pi.name: Memorize Pi to 15 decimal places
pi.objective: Know pi to at least 15 decimal places.

circle_math_1.name: Circle Math 1
circle_math_1.objective: Solve very simple problems relating elements of a circle.

trigonometry_1.name: The Pythagorean Theorem
trigonometry_1.objective: Solve numerical problems using the Pythagorean Theorem

area_1.name: Area 1
area_1.objective: Find the area of rectanges, squares, right triangles, and trapezoids.

circle_math_2.name: Circle Math 2
circle_math_2.objective: Solve numeric problems relating elements of a circle with mutliple algebraic steps; explain in words the significance of pi.

trigonometry_2.name: Trigonometry 2
trigonometry_2.objective: Solve for pieces of a triangle using sine, cosine, and tangent.

trigonometry_3.name: Trigonometry 3
trigonometry_3.objective: Solve trigonometric problems with variables in the denominator; given necessary pieces of information determine all other information regarding a triangle.

algbraic_circle_problems.name: Algebraic Circle Problems
algbraic_circle_problems.objective: Drive algebraic formulas to relate different pieces of a circle.

algebraic_area_problems.name: Algebraic Area and Trigonometric Problems
algebraic_area_problems.objective: Derive algebraic formulas from basic area and trigonometric formulas.

area_problems_with_nontradiational_infor.name: Area Problems with Nontraditional Information
area_problems_with_nontradiational_infor.objective: Figure out the area of a triangle or trapezoid with different types of area given.

trigonometric_identities.name: Trigonometric Identities
trigonometric_identities.objective: Derive trigonometric identities, such as the sum and difference angle formulas.

scientific_notation.name: Scientific Notation and Orders of Magnitude

limbo_to_sci.name: Putting numbers in correct scientific notation

sci_not_calc_1.name: Scientific Notation on a Calculator 1
parameters: Inclues single step problems like multiplying, dividing, and squaring.

sci_not_calc_2.name: Scientific Notation on a Calculator 2
parameters: More complex operations with multiple steps.

memorz_length_scales.name: Memorizing Length Scales
memorz_length_scales.objective: Recall, whenever necessary, various objects with a given order of magnitude in length.

memorz_mass_scales.name: Memorizing Mass Scales
memorz_mass_scales.objective: Recall, whenever necessary, various objects with a given order of magnitude in mass.

convert_betwween_metic.name: Convert Between Metric Units
convert_betwween_metic.objective: Convert from one metric unit to a different metric unit; in particular, from other masses to kilograms.

memorz_other_scales.name: Memorizing Other Scales
memorz_other_scales.objective: Recall, whenever necessary, various instances in the universe with particular orders of magnitude in speed, acceleration, energy, temperature, or time.

single_step_conversions.name: One-Step Conversions
single_step_conversions.objective: Complete one-step conversion problems using the conversion factor method.

double_step_converions.name: Two- and Three-Step Conversions
double_step_converions.objective: Complete two- and three-step conversiosn using the conversion factor method.

speed_conversions.name: Speed and Acceleration Conversions
speed_conversions.objective: Use conversion factors to convert values with numbers on the bottom

very_fast_conversions.name: Very Fast Conversions
very_fast_conversions.objective: Solve the most common conversion problems very quickly: grams and kilograms, meters and centimeters, seconds and milliseconds.

simplifying_dimensions.name: Simplifying Dimensions
simplifying_dimensions.objective: Simplify theoretical dimensions made of meters, kilograms, and seconds of different powers in the numerator and denominator.

four_step_conversiosn.name: Four-Step Conversions
four_step_conversiosn.objective: Solve conversion problems involving four conversion factors, especially converting between m/s and mph.

area_an_volume_conversions.name: Area and Volume Conversions
area_an_volume_conversions.objective: Convert quantities area and volume using conversion factors.

simplifying_dimensions_of_quantities.name: Simplifying Dimensions of Quantities
simplifying_dimensions_of_quantities.objective: Simplify dimensions made of different quantities, such as velocity and force, in numerators and denominators.

inventing_formulas_conversion_factors.name: Inventing New Formulas with Conversion Factors
inventing_formulas_conversion_factors.objective: Use conversion factors to solve novel and nondirect problems.

dimensional_analysis_with_algebra.name: Using Dimensional Analysis to Confirm Formulas
dimensional_analysis_with_algebra.objective: Confirm formulas and answers to symbolic algebra porblems with dimensional analysis.

derive_and_categorize_units.name: Derive and categorize units
derive_and_categorize_units.objective: Using physics formulas, derive all relevant physics quantities; cateogrize these quantities by their dimensions.

google_interview_questions.name: Google Interview Questions
google_interview_questions.objective: Use dimensional analysis to invent solutions to random, outside the box questions.

planck_units.name: Derive the Planck units
planck_units.objective: Use dimensional analysis to derive a set of units in which all physical constants are equal to one; Derive conversion factors between SI units and these units; Explain the significance of these units.

percent_error.name: Calculating Percent Difference and Percent Error

sig_fig_round.name: Rounding to a specific number of significant figures

sig_fig_prob_solving.name: Solving Problems with the Correct Number of Significant Figures

error_estimate.name: Estimating Error and Siginificant Figures in a Measurement
error_estimate.objective: Given a measurement and method of measuring, estimate the amount of error in that measurement and estimate how many sigificant figures would be appropriate to report.

sig_fig_purp.name: Explaining the purpose of significant figures.

back_of_envelp_calc.name: Back of the Envelope Calcuations
enduring_understandings: When presented with some novel sitaution or problem,
A good scientist can, in a small amount of space and without a calcualtor,
figure out an order of magnitude estimate of the answer.

kinematics_1.name: Forward Kinematics
enduring_understandings: Quantitative modeling of motion is at the core of physics.
Creating mathematical graphs, equations, and functions that accurately describe how an object moves.

speed_formula.name: The Speed Formula
speed_formula.objective: Solve problems using the formula distance equals speed multiplied by time.

accelrtn_formula.name: The Acceleration Formula
accelrtn_formula.objective: Solve for acceleration using the definition of acceleration formula.

kinemtc_graphs_1.name: Position Time Graphs
kinemtc_graphs_1.objective: Identify position-time graphs and motion maps for single-step descriptions of motion.

kinemtc_graphs_2.name: Velocity and Acceleration Graphs
kinemtc_graphs_2.objective: Identify velocity-time and acceleration-time graphs for single step descriptions of motion

kinematc_graphs_connectn.name: Kinematic Graphs Connection
kinematc_graphs_connectn.objective: For single step descriptions of motion, identify all three kinematic graphs that describe that motion.

kine_eq_1.name: Kinematic Equations 1
kine_eq_1.objective: Solve numerical algebraic problems with the kinematic equations
parameters: Information is presented in very straightfoward language.
Problems involve no more than 2 algebraic steps to solve.

kine_graph_informtn_1.name: Kinematic Graph Quantitative Information
kine_graph_informtn_1.objective: From a quantitative kinematic graph, gain information such as velocity and displacement.

kine_graph_informtn_2.name: Kinematic Graph Quantitative Information
kine_graph_informtn_2.objective: From a quantitative kinematic graph, gain information such as acceleration, initial and final velocity.

kine_eq_2.name: Kinematic Equations 2
kine_eq_2.objective: Solve numerical algebraic problems with the kinematic equations
parameters: Information is presented in realistic langauge
Problems involve no more than 3 algebraic stpes to solve

kine_eq_3.name: Kinematic Equations 3
kine_eq_3.objective: Solve numerical algebraic problems with the kinematic equations
parameters: Information is presented in straightfoward language
Problems involve many algebraic steps, including variables within parentheses.

kine_graph_two_step.name: Kinematic Graphs 2-step motion
kine_graph_two_step.objective: Given a straightfoward description of 2-step motion, identify kinematic graphs that match that motion.

kine_graph_story.name: Kinematic Graph Story
kine_graph_story.objective: Given a story describing motion in 3 or more steps, identify kinematic graphs that match that motion.

kine_graph_quant_1.name: Kinematic Graphs Quant 1
kine_graph_quant_1.objective: Given a quantitative position-time graph for single-step motion, draw correct quantitative velocity-time and acceleration-time graphs.

kine_graph_quant_2.name: Kinematic Graphs Quant 2
kine_graph_quant_2.objective: Given a quantitative acceleration-time or velocity-time graph for single-step motion, draw the other two relevant kinematic graphs.

kine_eq_stepwise.name: Kinematic Equations Stepwise
kine_eq_stepwise.objective: Solve the kinematic equations for step-wise motion

kine_graph_stepwise.name: Quantitative Kinematic Graph Stepwise
kine_graph_stepwise.objective: For a quantitative description of step-wise motion, create three quantitative kinematic graphs.

flying_to_mars.name: Flying to Mars
flying_to_mars.objective: Demonstrate using kinematic equations and graphs how a spaceship can get to Mars faster through constant acceleration and deceleration.

newtons_second_law.name: Newton's Second Law
newtons_second_law.objective: Use Newton's Second Law to solve simple numeric problems.

finding_net_force.name: Finding Net Force
finding_net_force.objective: Given a free-body diagram, determine the vector net force acting on an object.

momentm_formula.name: The Momentum Formula
momentm_formula.objective: Use the momentum formula to solve numerical problems.

memorz_conserv_momentm.name: Memorize the Conservation of Momentum
memorz_conserv_momentm.objective: Memorize, word for word, the conservation of momentum.

conserv_momentm_1.name: Conservation of Momentum 1
conserv_momentm_1.objective: Use the conservation of momentum to solve simple collision problems.

conserv_momentm_2.name: Conservation of Momentum 2
conserv_momentm_2.objective: Use the conservation of momentum to solve explosion problems and perfectly inelastic colision problems.

conserv_momentm_derivatn_1.name: Conservation of Momentum Formula Derivation 1
conserv_momentm_derivatn_1.objective: Derive the formula that explains a collision problem and explain what each term of that formula represents.

conserv_momentm_derivatn_2.name: Conservation of Momentum Formula Derivation 2
conserv_momentm_derivatn_2.objective: Derive a formula that explains explosion or perfectly inelastic collision problems and explin what each term of that formula represents.

elastc_collisn_derivatn.name: Elastic Collision Equation Derivation
elastc_collisn_derivatn.objective: Derive and explain formulas that describe an elastic collision.

pool_ball_collisn.name: Advanced Pool Ball Collision
pool_ball_collisn.objective: Derive formulas that explain pool ball collisions and use relate these formulas to the actual reality in a pool ball collision.

newtons_cradle.name: Explaining Newton's Cradle
newtons_cradle.objective: Use the conservation of momentum to explain how a Newton's Cradle works.

memorz_consvr_energy.name: Memorize The Conservation of Energy
memorz_consvr_energy.objective: Recite the conservation of energy word for word.

distance_displacement.name: Distance and Displacement
distance_displacement.objective: Find the distance and displacement of simple descriptions of 1-D motion.

very_basic_vectors_and_scalars.name: Very Basic Vectors and Scalars
very_basic_vectors_and_scalars.objective: Give very basic definitions and examples of vectors and scalars.

avg_speed_avg_vel.name: Average Speed and Average Velocity
avg_speed_avg_vel.objectives: Given simple descriptions of 1-dimensional motion determine distance, displacement, average speed, and average velocity.
parameters: Equations are not given on quiz.

axis_positn.name: Defining Axis and Position
axis_positn.objectives: Determine the position and displacement of a walking man with different origins and direction of axes.

direct_vel_acc.name: Direction of Velocity and Acceleration
direct_vel_acc.objectives: For different descriptions of motion and motion maps, determine the correct directions of velocity and acceleration.

two_directn_graphs.name: Kinematic Graphs of Two-Direction Motion
two_directn_graphs.objectives: Select qualitative kinematic graphs related to description of single step, accelerated and decelerated motion in two different directions.

two_directn_eq.name: Two-Direction Kinematic Equations
two_directn_eq.objective: Model two direction motion using positive and negative values and use this to solve kinematic equations involving motion in two different directions; interpret results of equations.
parameters: Equations are not given on quiz.

two_directn_eq_2.name: Two-Direction Kinematic Equations 2
two_directn_eq_2.objective: Model two direction motion using positive and negative values and use this to solve kinematic equations involving motion in two different directions; interpret results of equations.
parameters: Equations are not given on quiz.

two_directn_multstp_graphs.name: Kinematic Graphs of Multi-Step Two-Direction Motion
two_directn_multstp_graphs.objective: Given a story that involevs motion in mulitple-steps in different directions, identify kinematic graphs that best reflect this motion.

full_model.name: Create a Full Model of Two-Direction Motion
full_model.objective: Create a full graphical and functional model of a complex two-direction motion situation, such as a suicide spring.

parablc_arcs.name: Parabolic Arcs
parablc_arcs.objective: Draw parabolic arcs to show projectile motion, recognize and demonstrate that projectil motion always occurs in parabolic arcs.

falling_problems_numerc.name: Falling: Numeric Problems
falling_problems_numerc.objective: Solve numeric problems about objects falling down and objects thrown downards.

falling_kinemtc_graphs.name: Falling: Kinematic Graphs
falling_kinemtc_graphs.objective: Draw qualitative kinematic graphs for objects either falling down or thrown downward.

pop_up_problems_numerc.name: Pop-Up: Numeric Problems
pop_up_problems_numerc.objective: Solve for unknown numeric quantities when an object is thrown directly upwards.

horizntl_launch_conceptl.name: Horizontal Launch: Conceptual
horizntl_launch_conceptl.objective: In writing, describe motion in different dimensions when an object is launched horizontally; relate this motion to the free-body diagram using Newton's Model

horizntl_launch_numerc.name: Horizontal Launch: Numeric
horizntl_launch_numerc.objective: Solve for unknown numeric quantities when an object is launched from a cliff horizontally.

pop_up_newtons_model.name: Pop-Up: Newton's Model
pop_up_newtons_model.objective: Relate the motion of an object thrown directly to the free-body diagram using Newton's Model.

pop_up_kinemtc_graphs.name: Pop-Up: Kinematic Graphs
pop_up_kinemtc_graphs.objective: Draw qualitative kinematic graphs of an object thrown directly upward.

bullet_drop.name: Bullet Drop Conundrum
bullet_drop.objective: Explain the bullet drop conundrum in words.

pop_up_algebrc.name: Pop-Up: Symbolic
pop_up_algebrc.objective: Symbolically solve for relevant quantities when an object is thrown directly into the air.

horizontal_launch_kinemtc_graphs.name: Horizontal Launch: Kinematic Graphs
horizontal_launch_kinemtc_graphs.objective: Draw qualitative kinematic graphs in each dimension for an object launched horizontally.

angled_launch_conceptl.name: Angled Launch Conceptual
angled_launch_conceptl.objective: Conceptually explain the motion in each dimension of an object launched at an angle; relate this motion to the free-body diagram using Newton's Model.

angled_launch_numerc.name: Angled Launch Numeric
angled_launch_numerc.objective: Solve for relevant unknown numeric quantities when an object is launched upward at an angle.

angled_launch_algebrc.name: Angled Launch: Symbolic
angled_launch_algebrc.objective: With a cannon fired upward at a angle, algebraically solve for relevant quantities in terms of common known quantities.

angled_launch_kinemtc_graphs.name: Angled Launch: Kinematic Graphs
angled_launch_kinemtc_graphs.objective: Draw qualitative kinematic graphs for an object fired from a cannon at an upward angle.

angled_launch_high_ground.name: Cannon Fired From High Ground
angled_launch_high_ground.objective: Determine the range of a cannon fired at an angle from a high ground.

aiming_cannon_laser_pointers.name: Aim a cannon with laser pointers.
aiming_cannon_laser_pointers.objective: Determine a method to aim a cannon and expect a direct hit with laser pointers.

electrmgntc_spectrm.name: The Electromagnetic Spectrum: Analytical
enduring_understandings: The electromagnetic spectrum contains seven types of electromagnetic waves, including visible light.
While all waves are experienced and applied in qualitatively different waves, they are all the same thing: oscillating electric and magnetic energy.
The only true differences amongst electromagnetic waves are quantitative values: wavelength, frequency, and photon energy
These three values are related by fundamental constants.
Frequency and energy are directly proportional, while wavelength is inversely proportional to both.

memorz_electrmgntc_spectrm_1.name: Electromagnetic Spectrum 1
memorz_electrmgntc_spectrm_1.objective: Memorize the Electromagnetic Spectrum and the colors separately in order from longest to shortest wavelength; relate different waves using the terms wavelength and frequency (multiple choice)

chosing_color_by_wavelngth.name: Choosing Colors by Wavelength
chosing_color_by_wavelngth.objective: For visible electromagnetic waves of specific wavelengths, determine the color of that wave.

memorz_electromgntc_spectrm_2.name: Electromagnetic Spectrum 2
memorz_electromgntc_spectrm_2.objective: Memorize the Electromagnetic Spectrum and colors as a single spectrum in order from longest to shortest wavelength; relate different waves using the terms wavelength, frequency, and energy (short answer).

chosing_electrmgntc_by_wavelgnth.name: Choosing Electromagnetic Wave by Wavelength
chosing_electrmgntc_by_wavelgnth.objective: Given a wave of a particular wavelength of any order of magnitude, determine what type of electromagnetic wave is represented.

wave_formulas_1.name: Wave Formulas 1
wave_formulas_1.objective: Quantitatively relate wavelength, frequency, and photon energy of a wave; problems presented step by step

wave_proportionality.name: Wave proportionality
wave_proportionality.objective: Relate wavelength, frequency, and energy of waves using proportionality rules.

wave_formulas_2.name: Wave Formulas 2
wave_formulas_2.objective: Quantitatively relate wavelength, frequency, and photon energy of a wave; problems are asked in all directions in tabular form

logarthmc_graph.name: Logarithmic Graph of the EM Spectrum
logarthmc_graph.objective: Create a logarithmic graph which shows the range of each type of electromagnetic wave with scales in wavelength, eneergy, and frequency.

hydrogen_spectrum.name: The Hydrogen Spectrum
hydrogen_spectrum.objective: Identify the wavelengths and colors of photons released by a hydrogen atom as an electron moves within the atom.

visible_experience.name: Visible Light and the Human Experience
visible_experience.objective: From your knowledge of the electromagnetic spectrum, surmise philosophical conclucions on the human expereince and the role of humans in the universe.

basic_infrared_camera.name: Basic Infrared Camera
basic_infrared_camera.objective: Explain an infrared camera very simply.

identfy_applictns.name: Identify Applications of Electromagnetic Waves
identfy_applictns.objective: In writing, identify human applications of different types of electromagnetic wave.

identfy_astronmcl.name: Identify Astronomical Occurrences of Electromagnetic Waves
identfy_astronmcl.objective: Identify examples of how electromagnetic waves apply to astronomy.
